# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

# Solution 1 - Using String#split, String#gsub, and String#strip

```ruby
def clean_column(col)
    col.downcase.gsub(/[^a-z0-9]/i, "_").split(" ").join("_")
end
```

## Explanation 1

* `col.downcase` puts the string in lower case
* `String#gsub` finds and replaces any non-word characters (`[^a-z0-9]`) with an underscore ("_"). The "i" at the end makes this case insensitive so that uppercase letters are replaced, too.
* `String#split(" ")` splits the string into pieces at whitespace, and returns them as an array
* `Array#join("_")` puts all of those strings together with underscores in between each one
